'''Sky Tonia Ferreira''' (born July 8, 1992) is an American singer, songwriter, model, and actress. As a teenager, Ferreira began uploading videos on [[Myspace]] of herself singing songs she had written, which led to her discovery by producers [[Bloodshy & Avant]] and an eventual recording contract with [[Parlophone]] in 2009. She released her first [[extended play]], ''[[As If! (EP)|As If!]]'', in 2011, which combined elements of [[electropop]] and [[dance music]]. Ferreira's second extended play ''[[Ghost (Sky Ferreira EP)|Ghost]]'' (2012), however, incorporated pop with more stripped-down song structures and featured collaborations with [[Jon Brion]] and [[Shirley Manson]], as well as the critically acclaimed track "[[Everything Is Embarrassing]]", which she composed with [[Dev Hynes]].
After multiple delays and disputes with her record label, Ferreira's debut [[studio album]] ''[[Night Time, My Time]]'' was released on October 29, 2013, and marked a departure from her former style, incorporating more experimental [[indie rock]] with [[synth-pop]] elements. The album was preceded by its lead single "[[You're Not the One]]". That year, she ventured into the film industry after appearing in [[Eli Roth]]'s ''[[The Green Inferno (film)|The Green Inferno]]'' and garnered media attention after being arrested for [[drug possession]]. She was exposed to a mainstream audience after having been announced as an opening act for the international [[Bangerz Tour]], headlined by [[Miley Cyrus]], which began on February 14, 2014.
Ferreira's earlier work incorporated elements of [[dance-pop]], while her recent projects experiment with [[acoustic music|acoustic]], [[New wave music|new wave]] and primarily [[indie rock]] musical styles. Her lyrical content originally incorporated themes of rebellion and teenage romance, and has since evolved to discuss personal insecurities and more mature romantic themes. Outside her work in the entertainment industry, she has modeled for several brands and magazines, including serving as the spokeswoman for the hair care brand [[Redken]] in 2014.
== Life and career ==
=== Early life and career beginnings === Sky Tonia Ferreira was born on July 8, 1992 in [[Venice, Los Angeles|Venice Beach, Los Angeles, California]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.californiabirthindex.org/birth/sky_tonia_ferreira_born_1992_21360214|title=Sky Tonia Ferreira, Born 07/08/1992 in California|publisher=[[California Birth Index]]|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref><ref name="marieclaire">{{cite web|last=Raisbeck|first=Fiona|url=http://www.marieclaire.co.uk/blogs/543083/sky-ferreira-this-summer-s-girl.html|title=Sky Ferreira: This Summer's Girl|work=[[Marie Claire]]|date=June 5, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Brumfitt|first=Stuart|url=http://www.wonderlandmagazine.com/2013/02/sky-ferreira-interview-with-everything-is-embarrasing-unicorn-kid-remix/|title=SKY FERREIRA: Interview plus 'Everything Is Embarrassing (Unicorn Kid remix)'|work=Wonderland|date=February 26, 2013|accessdate=June 7, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ghettonewsflash.com/2012/01/gnsf-move-over-pop-princesses-make-room-for-just-legal-sky-ferreira/|title=GNSF! Move over pop princesses, make room for just-legal: Sky Ferreira!|author=Dita Quiñones|publisher=Ghetto News Flash|date=January 8, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Ferreira's heritage is [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] and [[Portuguese people|Portuguese]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://portuguese-american-journal.com/sky-ferreira-releases-99tears-people/|title=Sky Ferreira releases "99Tears" – People – Portuguese American Journal|author=|date=|work=Portuguese American Journal|accessdate=September 8, 2015}}</ref>
Ferreira was largely raised by her grandmother, who had been [[Michael Jackson]]'s personal hairstylist for over 30 years.<ref name="details">{{cite web|last=Hartman|first=Darrell|url=http://www.details.com/celebrities-entertainment/music-and-books/201303/sky-ferreira-everything-is-embarrassing|title=Q&A: Sky Ferreira|work=[[Details (magazine)|Details]]|date=March 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> She commented, saying: "I was raised around him, I always saw him [and] had holidays with him and stuff like that", adding that she was unaware of his fame until she was 13 years old.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/11010080|title=Sky Ferreira on being friends with Michael Jackson|author1=Oli Wilson|author2=Kirstie Andrews|work=[[Newsbeat]]|date=August 18, 2010|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Ferreira expressed interest in singing as a child and, with Jackson's encouragement, Ferreira's grandmother enrolled her in opera lessons.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/rockandpopmusic/9952318/Sky-Ferreira-New-Faces.html|title=Sky Ferreira – New Faces|author=James Lachno|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=March 25, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Ferreira has stated that she was [[sexually assaulted]] in her adolescence twice, firstly involving a neighbor, and secondly in an incident that involved a stranger who had broken into her home.<ref name="rookie">{{cite web|last=Gevinson|first=Tavi|authorlink=Tavi Gevinson|url=http://www.rookiemag.com/2012/02/sky-ferreira/|title=American Dream: An Interview With Sky Ferreira|work=[[Rookie (magazine)|Rookie]]|date=February 29, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In an interview with ''[[Rookie (magazine)|Rookie]]'', Ferreira said: "I've never said anything [about this publicly] because I don't want it to define me, but I feel like it's appropriate to say something [here]. People feel like it defines you, and it doesn't. It's really unfortunate and disgusting and traumatizing, but it doesn't make you who you are."<ref name="rookie"/> Ferreira dropped out of high school after completing her sophomore year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefader.com/2013/08/20/sky-ferreira-everything-is-embarrassing/|title=Sky Ferreira: Everything Is Embarrassing|author=Lizzy Goodman|work=[[The Fader]]|date=August 20, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref>
Ferreira later began maintaining a [[Myspace]] profile where she uploaded demo versions of self-written tracks. Shortly before her 15th birthday, she wrote a letter to producers [[Bloodshy & Avant]] requesting that they offer a recording contract to her, which she says happened "kind of right off the bat" after they came across her profile.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blackbookmag.com/almost-famous-person-sky-ferreira-calls-famous-people-drag/|title=Almost Famous Person Sky Ferreira Calls Famous People a Drag|author=Adam Mrlik|work=[[BlackBook (magazine)|BlackBook]]|date=June 29, 2010|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In 2009, she was signed to [[Parlophone]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thelynxnewspaper.com/2013/11/sky-ferreiras-night-time-my-time/|title=Sky Ferreira's Night Time, My Time|author=Jeffrey Butler III|newspaper=The Lynx|date=November 14, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> and began finalizing the debut studio album that she says was first begun when she was 14 years old.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/interviews/a261074/sky-ferreira.html|title=Sky Ferreira|author=Nick Levine|work=[[Digital Spy]]|date=August 14, 2010|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In 2010, she ventured into the film and modelling industries after starring in the independent film ''[[Putty Hill]]''<ref name="allmusic">{{cite web|last=O'Brien|first=Jon|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/sky-ferreira-mn0002363198/biography|title=Sky Ferreira {{!}} Biography|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> and appearing in the magazines ''[[Dazed]]'' and ''[[Interview (magazine)|Interview]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dazeddigital.com/artsandculture/article/6290/1/dazed-confused-february-issue|title=Dazed & Confused: February Issue|work=[[Dazed]]|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Rachel|first=T. Cole|url=https://www.interviewmagazine.com/music/sky-ferreira|title=Sky Ferreira|work=[[Interview (magazine)|Interview]]|date=February 22, 2010|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref>
=== 2011–2012: ''As If!'' and ''Ghost'' === After releasing the tracks "17" and "[[One (Sky Ferreira song)|One]]", the latter having peaked at number 64 on the [[UK Singles Chart]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/artist/_/sky%20ferreira/|title=Sky Ferreira: Artist|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Ferreira announced that her debut studio album would be released on January 11, 2011. Its [[lead single]] "[[Obsession (Sky Ferreira song)|Obsession]]" peaked at number 37 on the US ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Dance Club Songs]] chart.<ref name="Awards">{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/sky-ferreira-mn0002363198/awards|title=Sky Ferreira {{!}} Awards|publisher=AllMusic|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> These plans never came to fruition, and were substituted for the [[extended play]] (EP) ''[[As If! (EP)|As If!]]'' and its lead single "[[Sex Rules]]" that March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.idolator.com/5782851/sky-ferreira-as-if-ep-cover|title=Sky Ferreira 'As If!' EP Cover Revealed|author=Robbie Daw|publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]|date=March 1, 2011|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> A writer for [[MuuMuse]] spoke favorably of her "vocal and musical versatility" and commended the project as a "rock solid 5-track collection of next-level crunchy pop cuts."<ref name="MuuMuse">{{cite web|url=http://www.muumuse.com/2011/03/sky-ferreira-as-if-ep-album-review.html/|title=Sky Ferreira: As If! EP (Album Review)|publisher=[[MuuMuse]]|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> During this time, Ferreira was featured in the advertising campaign for the [[Calvin Klein]] "CK One" product line alongside [[Cassie Ventura]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.idolator.com/5788312/sky-ferreira-complains-about-complainers-in-new-track-haters-anonymous|title=Sky Ferreira Complains About Complainers In New Track "Haters Anonymous"|author=Becky Bain|publisher=Idolator|date=March 7, 2011|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> The following year, she was photographed by [[Ellen von Unwerth]] for the cover of ''[[Vs. (magazine)|Vs.]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://models.com/work/vs-magazine-vs-magazine-ss-11-three-covers/39479|title=CS Magazine S/S/ 11 Four Covers (Vs. Magazine)|publisher=Models.com|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> and appeared in the [[Adidas]] "Originals" commercial with rappers [[Big Sean]] and [[Snoop Dogg]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/08/10/adidas-originals-commercial_n_923745.html|title=Adidas Originals Commercial Features Snoop Dogg, Big Sean, Unknown Mortal Orchestra And More|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=August 10, 2011|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref>
In November 2011, Ferreira announced that her debut studio album would be released in 2012, with a lead single planned to precede its release that February.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/skyferreira/posts/10150528201089115|title=Sky Ferreira – I recorded this almost 3 years ago & was...|publisher=[[Facebook]]|date=November 10, 2011|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> She was later revealed to have been working with [[Jon Brion]], [[Greg Kurstin]], and [[Shirley Manson]] on the project.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elle.com/news/culture/sky-ferreira-would-love-to-see-fiona-apple-in-a-tarantino-movie-34500|title=Sky Ferreira Would Love to See Fiona Apple In A Tarantino Movie|author=Alex Catarinella|work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|date=December 22, 2011|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In early 2012, Ferreira revealed ''Wild at Heart'' as the title of her record,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.popjustice.com/thenews/sky-ferreiras-got-a-name-for-her-album/70923/|title=Sky Ferreira's got a name for her album|author=Mikey|publisher=[[Popjustice]]|date=January 23, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> and confirmed "24 Hours" and "Swamp Girl" for its track listing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.popjustice.com/thenews/sky-ferreiras-new-single-is-fucking-awesome/71673/|title=Sky Ferreira's new single is "fucking AWESOME"|author=Brad O'Mance|publisher=Popjustice|date=February 7, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> "Lost in My Bedroom", described by Ferreira as "the most electro pop [song] on the album", surfaced online that March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.idolator.com/6206861/sky-ferreira-lost-in-my-bedroom|title=Sky Ferreira's "Lost In My Bedroom": Listen|author=Becky Bain|publisher=Idolator|date=March 2, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> After releasing the music video for the track "[[Red Lips (song)|Red Lips]]" in June, she stated that she renamed the record ''I'm Not Alright''.<ref name="complex">{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2012/06/interview-sky-ferreira-talks-red-lips-terry-richardson-socialite|title=Interview: Sky Ferreira Talks "Red Lips," Terry Richardson and Being Seen As A Socialite|author=Tara Aquino|work=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]|date=June 15, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref>
With her debut studio album still unreleased, Ferreira announced that her second extended play ''[[Ghost (Sky Ferreira EP)|Ghost]]'' would be released in October. It respectively peaked at numbers 8 and 71 on the US ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Top Heatseekers]] and Alternative Albums component charts to the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].<ref name="Awards" /> Its second single "[[Everything is Embarrassing]]" was described by Katherine St. Asaph of [[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]] as the track where Ferreira "could well have her breakout moment", complimenting it for beginning with "snappy, crisply sung dance-pop about long-awaited moments" and eventually transitioning into "what should be a buoyant chorus".<ref name="Pitchfork">{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/reviews/tracks/14138-everything-is-embarrassing/|title=Sky Ferreira: "Everything is Embarrassing"|author=Katherine St. Asaph|work=[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]|date=August 31, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In her debut television performance, Ferreira performed the track on ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]'' in January 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/videos/sky-ferreira-makes-tv-debut-on-fallon-20130108|title=Sky Ferreira Makes TV Debut on 'Fallon'|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=January 8, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> The previously leaked track "Lost in My Bedroom" was included on ''Ghost'', and was featured on an episode of [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'' in December.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wetpaint.com/greys-anatomy/articles/greys-anatomy-songs-music-from-season-9-episode-9-run-baby-run|title=Grey's Anatomy Songs: Music From Season 9, Episode 9: "Run, Baby, Run"|author=Rebecca Martin|publisher=[[Wetpaint]]|date=December 13, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref>
=== 2013–2014: ''Night Time, My Time'' and support touring === [[File:Sky Ferreira the pageant 2013 1.jpg|Ferreira performing at The Pageant in [[St. Louis]] in 2013|thumb|left]] In June 2013, Ferreira starred in the short film ''IRL'' playing Angel, which has been described as "an eye-opening look into the reality of young life in New York".<ref name="IRL">{{cite web|url=http://www.nowness.com/day/2013/6/20/sky-ferreira-in-real-life|title=Sky Ferreira: In Real Life|publisher=[[NOWNESS]]|date=June 20, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> That month, she again renamed her debut studio album ''I Will'', and stated that it would be released "later this summer".<ref name="marieclaire" /> She noted that it would be composed of "ten up-tempo songs, all still pretty [[electronic music|electronic]], although for some reason it comes across more [[pop rock|pop-rocky]] live."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://noisey.vice.com/blog/sky-ferreira-on-turning-21-weird-internet-rumors-and-amanda-bynes-brain|title=Sky Ferreira on Turning 21, Weird Internet Rumors, and Amanda Bynes' Brain|author=Georgie Okell|work=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]|date=June 12, 2013}}</ref> It was again renamed ''[[Night Time, My Time]]'', and announced to be released on October 29, 2013, by [[Capitol Records]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/51121-sky-ferreira-announces-debut-album-night-time-my-time/|title=Sky Ferreira Announces Debut Album Night Time, My Time|author1=Jenn Pelly|author2=Evan Minsker|work=Pitchfork|date=September 12, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Upon its release, it received favorable reviews from [[Music journalism|music critics]]; at [[Metacritic]], which assigns a [[standard score|normalized]] rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream critics, the album received an [[weighted mean|average]] score of 79, which indicates "generally favorable reviews", based on 30 reviews.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/night-time-my-time/sky-ferreira|title=Night Time, My Time Reviews|publisher=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' listed it as the fifth-best debut album of 2013,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/20-best-debuts-of-2013-20131210/sky-ferreira-night-time-my-time-19691231|title=Sky Ferreira, 'Night Time My Time'|work=Rolling Stone|date=December 10, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> noting its potent blending of synth-pop elements with a more grunge-inspired [[indie rock]] sound. The album was also listed as the 25th best overall album of the year by [[Complex (magazine)|Complex]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/12/the-50-best-albums-of-2013/sky-ferreira-night-time-my-time|title=The 50 Best Albums of 2013|work=Complex|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> The record debuted at number 45 on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].<ref name="Awards" /> "[[You're Not the One]]" was released as the lead single from ''Night Time, My Time'' on September 24, 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/youre-not-the-one-single/id701261417|title=You're Not the One – Single by Sky Ferreira|publisher=[[iTunes Store]] (US)|date=September 24, 2013|accessdate=September 24, 2013}}</ref>
In September, Ferreira starred as Kaycee in the independent film ''[[The Green Inferno (film)|The Green Inferno]]''.<ref name="TheGreenInferno">{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/green-inferno-toronto-review-624071|title=The Green Inferno: Toronto Review|author=Deborah Young|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=September 9, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In the early morning of September 14, she and her boyfriend, [[DIIV]] frontman [[Zachary Cole Smith]], were arrested at a traffic stop in [[Saugerties (village), New York|Saugerties, New York]] for [[drug possession]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/fashion/sky-ferreira-boyfriend-arrested-drug-possession-article-1.1459083|title=Marc Jacobs model Sky Ferreira, boyfriend arrested for drug possession|author=Victoria Taylor|newspaper=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|date=September 17, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Ferreira, who was in possession of [[MDMA|ecstasy]] tablets, was arrested on drug possession and [[resisting arrest]]; Smith was in possession of [[heroin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/news/sky-ferreira/72957|title=Sky Ferreira on drugs arrest: 'I know I'm not a drug addict'|work=[[NME]]|date=October 1, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> She bailed herself out.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://radio.com/2013/09/16/sky-ferreira-arrested-in-possession-of-ecstasy-heroin-also-found/|title=Sky Ferreira Arrested In Possession Of Ecstasy; Heroin Also Found|author=Annie Reuter|publisher=Radio.com|date=September 16, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In October, Ferreira cancelled the final week of her tour with [[Vampire Weekend]] after sustaining a hemorrhage to her vocal cords,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stereogum.com/1504501/sky-ferreira-cancels-shows-with-vampire-weekend/news/|title=Sky Ferreira Cancels Shows With Vampire Weekend|author=Claire Lobenfeld|website=[[Stereogum]]|date=October 2, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> which she later added was caused by a vocal node that was repeatedly misdiagnosed as laryngitis.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stereogum.com/1525382/qa-sky-ferreira-opens-up-about-her-tumultuous-year-and-long-delayed-debut-album/franchises/interview/|title=Q&A: Sky Ferreira Opens Up About Her Tumultuous Year And Long-Delayed Debut Album|author=T. Cole Rachel|website=Stereogum|date=October 16, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In November, Ferreira and [[Icona Pop]] were announced as the opening acts for [[Miley Cyrus]]' [[Bangerz Tour]], which began on February 14, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/miley-cyrus-enlists-icona-pop-and-sky-ferreira-to-open-tour-20131112|title=Miley Cyrus Enlists Icona Pop and Sky Ferreira to Open Tour|author=Jon Blistein|work=Rolling Stone|date=November 12, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> Later that month, she released her third extended play, ''Night Time, My Time: B-Sides Part 1''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/53146-sky-ferreira-releases-b-sides-collection/|title=Sky Ferreira Releases B-Sides Collection|author=Carrie Battan|work=Pitchfork|date=November 26, 2013|accessdate=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In December, Ferreira was announced as the spokeswoman for hair care brand [[Redken]].<ref name=redken />
On February 20, 2014, during the third performance opening for the Bangerz Tour, Ferreira fell and split open her shin onstage. After completing the performance, Ferreira was taken by ambulance to an [[Anaheim]] hospital and treated with 60 stitches. As a result of the injury, she was forced to temporarily pull out of support for the tour, but returned shortly after.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/news/sky-ferreira/75656|title=Sky Ferreira forced to pull out of Miley Cyrus tour support after injuring herself on stage|work=NME|date=February 22, 2014|accessdate=February 22, 2014}}</ref> On November 20, 2014, while on her North American tour, Ferreira debuted a new track called "Guardian".<ref>{{cite web|last=Beauchemin|first=Molly|title=Sky Ferreira Performs New Song "Guardian" Live|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/57627-sky-ferriera-performs-new-song-guardian-live/|work=Pitchfork|accessdate=July 10, 2015|date=November 28, 2014}}</ref>
=== 2015–present: ''Masochism'' and film roles === On July 16, 2014, Ferreira announced via [[Twitter]] that she was working on her second album.<ref>{{cite web |last=Ferreira |first=Sky |url=https://www.instagram.com/p/qiTP_SHDKo/ |title=Just started recording my 2nd album & here's the first track |publisher=[[Instagram]] |date=July 16, 2014 |accessdate=January 8, 2016}}</ref> She described the sound of the album as "more aggressive" and is working with [[Ariel Rechtshaid]] and [[Justin Raisen]], with whom she produced ''Night Time, My Time'', as well as [[Bobby Gillespie]] and [[Andrew Innes]] of Scottish band [[Primal Scream]]. Ferreira also expressed the wish to collaborate with [[Gesaffelstein]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Lipshutz|first=Jason|title=Catching Up with Sky Ferreira: On Recording with Primal Scream, Splitting From Troy Carter & Regaining Control of Her Career|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6327424/sky-ferreira-interview-new-album-primal-scream-troy-carter|website=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=February 19, 2015|date=November 21, 2014}}</ref> She also appeared in the 2016 comedy-drama film ''[[Elvis & Nixon]]'', directed by [[Liza Johnson]],<ref name=FiveCast>{{cite news|last=Reilly|first=Travis|title=Colin Hanks, Johnny Knoxville, Alex Pettyfer Added to 'Elvis & Nixon'|url=http://www.thewrap.com/colin-hanks-johnny-knoxville-alex-pettyfer-added-to-elvis-nixon/|accessdate=February 6, 2015|publisher=[[TheWrap]]|date=January 16, 2015}}</ref> and ''[[The Trust (film)|The Trust]]'', which stars [[Nicolas Cage]] and [[Elijah Wood]], and is directed by Benjamin and [[Alex Brewer]].<ref name=thetrust>{{cite web|last=Minton|first=Turner|title=Sky Ferreira Will Star Opposite Nicolas Cage and Elijah Wood in Crime Film The Trust|url=http://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2015/02/sky-ferreira-will-star-opposite-nicholas-cage-and.html|work=[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]]|accessdate=February 20, 2015|date=February 10, 2015}}</ref>
Ferreira confirmed on April 7, 2015, that her upcoming second studio album will be titled ''Masochism''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Gordon|first=Jeremy|title=Sky Ferreira Announces New Album Title|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/59137-sky-ferreira-announces-new-album-title/|work=Pitchfork|date=April 6, 2015|accessdate=July 10, 2015}}</ref> On May 12, 2015, the singer announced that she would be releasing a film co-written and directed by her frequent collaborator Grant Singer accompanied by a new single with the album scheduled to be released later in the year.<ref>{{cite web|last=Claymore|first=Gabriela|title=Sky Ferreira And Grant Singer Co-Writing Film Featuring New Ferreira Song For Summer Release|url=http://www.stereogum.com/1801471/sky-ferreira-and-grant-singer-co-writing-film-featuring-new-ferreira-song-for-summer-release/news/|website=Stereogum|accessdate=July 10, 2015|date=May 13, 2015}}</ref> [[Jimmy Choo]] revealed on June 4 that Ferreira would be the face of their newest fragrance named Illicit.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jimmy Choo reveals new fragrance and names Sky Ferreira as face of campaign|url=http://www.fashionmonitor.com/news/jKw/Jimmy-Choo-reveals-new-fragrance-and-names-Sky-Ferreira-as-face-of-campaign|publisher=Fashion Monitor|accessdate=June 4, 2015|date=June 4, 2015}}</ref> She collaborated with Primal Scream on the song "Where the Light Gets In", which was released on February 1, 2016 as the lead single from the band's eleventh studio album, ''[[Chaosmosis]]''.<ref>{{cite web |last=Minsker |first=Evan |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/59031-primal-scream-and-sky-ferreira-vamp-it-up-in-where-the-light-gets-in-video/ |title=Primal Scream and Sky Ferreira Vamp It Up in "Where the Light Gets In" Video |work=Pitchfork |date=February 1, 2016 |accessdate=April 30, 2016}}</ref> It was announced on April 25, 2016, that Ferreira would guest-star in the [[Twin Peaks (2017 TV series)|2017 sequel]] to [[David Lynch]]'s 1990s television series ''[[Twin Peaks]]''.<ref name="TwinPeaks">{{cite web |last=Strauss |first=Matthew |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/65047-twin-peaks-revival-to-star-trent-reznor-sky-ferreira-eddie-vedder-sharon-van-etten-more/ |title="Twin Peaks" Revival to Star Trent Reznor, Sky Ferreira, Eddie Vedder, Sharon Van Etten, More |work=Pitchfork |date=April 25, 2016 |accessdate=April 25, 2016}}</ref> In October 2016, she was cast in [[Jonas Åkerlund]]'s upcoming film ''Lords of Chaos'', based on the 1998 [[Lords of Chaos (book)|book of the same name]] by [[Michael Jenkins Moynihan|Michael Moynihan]] and Didrik Søderlind.<ref>{{cite web |last=Yoo |first=Noah |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/69165-sky-ferreira-cast-in-beyonce-lemonade-directors-black-metal-movie/ |title=Sky Ferreira Cast in Beyoncé ''Lemonade'' Director's Black Metal Movie |work=Pitchfork |date=October 20, 2016 |accessdate=October 22, 2016}}</ref>
Ferreira appeared in [[Edgar Wright]]'s 2017 [[heist film]] ''[[Baby Driver]]'', portraying the mother of lead character Baby (played by [[Ansel Elgort]]). She also contributed a cover of the [[Commodores]] song "[[Easy (Sky Ferreira song)|Easy]]" to [[Baby Driver (soundtrack)|the film's soundtrack]], produced by [[Nigel Godrich]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Yoo |first=Noah |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/listen-to-sky-ferreiras-baby-driver-cover-of-the-commodores-easy/ |title=Listen to Sky Ferreira's ''Baby Driver'' Cover of the Commodores' "Easy" |work=Pitchfork |date=June 28, 2017 |accessdate=January 6, 2018}}</ref> On December 23, 2017, Ferreira announced plans to release a visual EP in 2018 before ''Masochism''. {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2016}} {{good article}} {{Infobox video game | title = The Binding of Isaac | image = Binding of isaac header.jpg | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[OS X]]|[[Linux]]}} | released = September 28, 2011 | genre = [[Roguelike]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] | engine = Adobe Flash | designer = [[Edmund McMillen]]
Florian Himsl | artist = Edmund McMillen | composer = [[Danny Baranowsky]] }} '''''The Binding of Isaac''''' is an [[indie game|indie]] [[roguelike]] video game designed by [[Edmund McMillen]] and Florian Himsl, initially released in 2011 for [[Microsoft Windows]]; the game was later ported for [[OS X]], and [[Linux]] operating systems. The game's title and plot are inspired by the [[Bible|Biblical]] story of the [[Binding of Isaac]]. In the game, Isaac's mother receives a message from [[God]] demanding the life of her son as proof of her [[faith]], and Isaac flees into the monster-filled basement of their home where he must fight to survive. Players control Isaac or one of six other unlockable characters through a [[procedural generation|procedurally generated]] dungeon in a roguelike manner, fashioned after those of ''[[The Legend of Zelda (video game)|The Legend of Zelda]]'', defeating monsters in real-time combat while collecting items and power-ups to defeat [[boss (video gaming)|bosses]] and eventually Isaac's mother. The game was the result of a week-long game jam between McMillen and Himsl to develop a ''The Legend of Zelda''-inspired roguelike that allowed McMillen to showcase his feelings about both positive and negative aspects of religion that he had come to discover from conflicts between his Catholic and [[born again]] Christian family members while growing up. McMillen had considered the title a risk but one he could take after the financial success of ''[[Super Meat Boy]]'', and released it without much fanfare to [[Steam (software)|Steam]] in September 2011, not expecting many sales. The game soon gained popularity partially as a result of various [[Let's Play (video gaming)|Let's Play]] videos showcasing the title. McMillen and Himsl released an expansion "Wrath of the Lamb" in May 2012, but were limited from further expansion due to limitations with the [[Adobe Flash|Flash]] platform. They had started working with [[Nintendo]] in 2012 to release a [[Nintendo 3DS|3DS]] version, but Nintendo later backed out of the deal, citing controversy over the game's religious themes. Developer [[Nicalis]] worked with McMillen in 2014 to complete a remake of the game, ''[[The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth]]'', bringing additional features that McMillen had planned that exceeded Flash's limitation, as well as to improve the game's graphics and enable ports for other systems beyond personal computers, including [[PlayStation 4]] and [[PlayStation Vita|Vita]], [[Xbox One]], [[Wii U]], [[Nintendo 3DS]], and the [[Nintendo Switch]]. McMillen is working with James Id to develop ''[[The Legend of Bum-bo]]'', which will serve as a [[prequel]] to ''The Binding of Isaac''. ''The Binding of Isaac'' has been well-received, with critics praising the game's roguelike nature to encourage repeated playthroughs. By July 2014, McMillen reported over 3 million copies had been sold. The game has been said to contribute to renewed interest in the roguelike genre from both players and developers. == Gameplay == [[File:The Binding of Isaac screenshot.png|thumb|left|Gameplay screenshot of ''The Binding of Isaac'', showing Isaac attacking (center) and two enemies (top left and top right)]] ''The Binding of Isaac'' is a [[Video game graphics#Top-down perspective|top-down]] [[dungeon crawl]]er game, presented using [[Sprite (computer graphics)|two-dimensional sprites]], in which the player controls Isaac or other unlockable characters as they explore the dungeons located in Isaac's basement. The characters differ in speed, amount of health, amount of damage they deal, and other attributes. The game's mechanics and presentation is similar to the dungeons of ''[[The Legend of Zelda (video game)|The Legend of Zelda]]'', while incorporating random, [[procedural generation|procedurally-generated]] levels in the manner of a [[roguelike]] game.{{cite web | url = https://www.wired.com/gamelife/2011/09/binding-of-isaac/ |title = Nightmarish Indie The Binding of Isaac Shooting Up Steam Next Week | date = September 19, 2011 | accessdate = December 23, 2015 | first = Jason | last = Scheirer | work = [[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] }} On each floor of the basement dungeon, the player must fight monsters in a room before continuing onto the next room. This is most commonly done by the character's tears as bullets in the style of a [[shoot 'em up|twin-stick shooter]], but the player can also use a limited supply of bombs to damage enemies and clear out parts of the room. Other methods of defeating enemies become possible as the character gains [[power-up]]s, items that are automatically worn by the player-character when picked up that can alter the character's core attributes, such as increasing health or the strength of each tear, or cause additional side effects, such as for allowing charged tear shots to be fired after holding down a controller button for a short while, or a means to fire tears behind the character. Power-ups include passive items that improve the character's attributes automatically, active power-ups that can be used once before they are recharged by completing additional rooms in the dungeon, and single-use power-ups such as pills or [[Tarot]] cards that confer a one-time benefit when used, such as regaining full health, or increasing or decreasing all attributes of the character. The effect of power-ups stack, so that the player may come into highly-beneficial power-up combinations.{{cite web | url = http://www.pcgamer.com/the-binding-of-isaac-review/ | title = The Binding of Isaac Review | first = Chris | last = Thursten | date = December 17, 2011 | accessdate = April 25, 2016 | work = [[PC Gamer]] }} Once a room is cleared of monsters, it will remain clear, allowing the player to re-trace their way through the level, though once they move onto the next level, they cannot return. Along the way, the player can collect money to buy power-ups from shopkeepers, keys to unlock special treasure rooms, and new weapons and power-ups to strengthen their chances against the enemies. The player's health is tracked by a number of hearts; if the character loses all their hearts, the game ends in [[permanent death|permadeath]] and the player must start over from a freshly-generated dungeon. Each floor of the dungeon includes a [[boss (video game)|boss]] which the player must defeat before continuing to the next level. On the sixth of eight floors, the player fights Isaac's mother; after defeating her, Isaac crawls into her womb. Later levels are significantly harder, culminating in a fight against the heart of Isaac's mother on the eighth floor. An optional ninth floor, [[Sheol]] contains the boss [[Satan]]. Winning the game with certain characters or by certain conditions unlocks new power-ups that might appear in the dungeon or the ability to use one of the other characters. The game tracks the various power-ups that the player has found over time which can be reviewed from the game's menus. == Plot == ''The Binding of Isaac''{{'}}s plot is very loosely inspired by the [[Binding of Isaac|biblical story of the same name]]. Isaac, a child, and his mother live in a small house on a hill, both happily keeping to themselves, with Isaac drawing pictures and playing with his toys, and his mother watching Christian broadcasts on television. Isaac's mother then hears "a voice from above", stating her son is corrupted with sin, and needs to be saved. It asks her to remove all that was evil from Isaac, in an attempt to save him. His mother obliges, taking away his toys, drawings, and even his clothes. The voice once again speaks to Isaac's mother, stating that Isaac must be cut off from all that is evil in the world. Once again, his mother obliges, and locks Isaac inside his room. Once more, the voice speaks to Isaac's mother. It states she has done well, but it still questions her devotion, and tells her to sacrifice her son. She obliges, grabbing a butcher's knife from the kitchen and walking to Isaac's room. Isaac, watching through a sizable crack in his door, starts to panic. He finds a trapdoor hidden under his rug and jumps in, just before his mother opens his bedroom door. Isaac then puts the paper he was drawing onto his wall, which becomes the title screen. During the game's loading points, Isaac is shown curled up in a ball, crying. His thoughts are visible, ranging among rejection from his mother and humiliation from his peers to a scenario involving his own death. The game features 13 possible endings, one after each major boss fight. == Development and release == ''The Binding of Isaac'' was developed following the release of ''[[Super Meat Boy]]'', which McMillen considered a significant risk and a large time effort. When ''Super Meat Boy'' was released to both critical praise and strong sales, he felt that he no longer had to worry about the consequences of taking risks with his finances supported by its sales. He also considered he could take further risk with the concept. ''The Binding of Isaac''{{'}}s main concept was the result of a weeklong game jam that McMillen had with Florian Himsl; at the time, his co-contributor on ''Super Meat Boy'', Tommy Refenes, was on vacation. The concept McMillen had was two-fold: to develop a [[roguelike]] title based on the first ''[[The Legend of Zelda (video game)|The Legend of Zelda]]'' game's dungeon structure, and to develop a game that addressed McMillen's thoughts on religion.{{cite web | url = http://gamasutra.com/view/feature/182380/postmortem_mcmillen_and_himsls_.php | title = Postmortem: McMillen and Himsl's The Binding of Isaac | first = Edmund | last = McMillen | date = November 28, 2012 | accessdate = December 20, 2015 | work = [[Gamasutra]] }} McMillen had been inspired by [[Shigeru Miyamoto]], the designer of the original ''Zelda'' games. Random rooms were created for each floor of the dungeon by selecting ten to twenty rooms from a pre-built library of 200 layouts, adding in the monsters, items, and other features, and then including fixed rooms that would be found on each floor, such as a boss room and treasure room. In expanding the gameplay, McMillen used the structure of ''Zelda''{{'}}s dungeons to design how the player would progress through the game. In a typical ''Zelda'' dungeon, according to McMillen, the player acquires a new item that helps them to progress farther in the game; he took the same inspiration to assure that each level in ''Isaac'' included at least one item and one bonus item on defeating the boss that would boost the character's attributes. McMillen also wanted to encourage players to experiment to learn how things work within ''Isaac'', mirroring how Miyamoto had done with the original ''Zelda'' game. He designed the level progression to become more difficult with the player's progression in the game, as well as additional content that became available after beating the game as to make it feel like the game was long. McMillen designed four of the selectable characters based on the main classes of ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]''—fighter, thief, cleric and wizard.{{cite web | url = http://edmundmcmillen.blogspot.com/2011/09/progression.html | title = Progression? | first = Edmund | last = McMillen | date = September 17, 2011 | accessdate = April 25, 2016 | publisher = [[Blogspot]] }} On the story side, McMillen explained that the religious tone is based on his own experiences with his family, split between Catholics and born-again Christians. McMillen noted that while both sides born out faith from the same Bible, their attitudes were different; he found some of the Catholic rituals his family performed inspiring, while other beliefs they had were condemning of several pastimes McMillen had participated in like ''Dungeons & Dragons''. He took inspiration from that duality to create ''Isaac''{{'}}s narrative, showing how religion can both instill harmful feelings while also bringing about dark creativity. McMillen also considered the scare tactics used by the [[Christian right]] to condemn popular media of the 1980s, such as [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] and video games.{{cite web | url =http://www.destructoid.com/how-a-killer-christian-shmup-roguelike-came-to-steam-206601.phtml | title = How a killer Christian shmup roguelike came to Steam | work = [[Destructoid]] | first = Jonathan | last = Holmes | date = July 21, 2011 | accessdate = April 25, 2016 }} McMillen noted how many of the propaganda films from this period features satanic cults that would sacrifice children, and he noted how many Biblical stories mirrored these concepts, subsequently building the story around that.{{Cite web | url = https://venturebeat.com/community/2011/09/02/interview-with-team-meats-edmund-mcmillen/ | title = The Binding of Isaac: Interview with Team Meat’s Edmund McMillen | first = Rachel | last = Jagielski | date = September 2, 2011 | accessdate = April 25, 2016 | work = [[VentureBeat]] }} He also stated that he also tended to like "really weird stuff" relating to [[Toilet humour|toilet humor]] and similar types of [[off-color humor]] that did not sit well with his family and which he had explored in previous games before ''Super Meat Boy''.{{Cite web | url = http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-06-29-the-binding-of-edmund-mcmillen | title = The Binding of Edmund McMillen | date = June 26, 2012 | accessdate = December 20, 2015 | first = Nathan | last = Grayson | work = [[Eurogamer]] }} While ''Super Meat Boy'' helped to make his reputation (including being one of the featured developers in ''[[Indie Game: The Movie]]''), he felt it was a "safe" game considering his preferred type of humor, and used ''Isaac'' to return to this form, considering that the game could easily be "career suicide" but would make a statement about what he really wanted to do. Within the week, they had a working game written in [[Adobe Flash]]'s [[ActionScript]] 2. The two agreed to complete it out as a game they could release on [[Steam (software)|Steam]] though with no expectations of sales. Completion of the game from the prototype to the finished state took about 3 months with part-time development. During this time, they discovered there were several limitations on the size and scope of both Flash and ActionScript that limited how much they could do with the game, but continued to use the tools as to release the title. McMillen said that because they were not worried about sales, they were able to work with Valve to release the game without fears of censorship or having to seek an [[ESRB]] rating. Releasing through Steam also enabled them to update the game freely, several times on its initial release, an aspect that they could not do with other consoles without significant cost to themselves. They did release without significant end-user testing, as it would have taken several hundreds of users to go through all the various combinations of items that a player could collect, and McMillen recognized they had released the title with their buyers being playtesters for them. A week after the Steam release, McMillen released a [[game demo|demo]] version via the website ''[[Newgrounds]]''.{{cite web | url =http://www.cinemablend.com/games/Binding-Isaac-Demo-Released-Big-Update-Way-35870.html | title = The Binding Of Isaac Demo Released, Big Update On The Way | first = Pete | last = Haas | date = October 9, 2011 | accessdate = December 23, 2015 | work = Cinema Blend }} Merge Games produced a physical edition that included the game, soundtrack, and a poster, for stores in the United Kingdom in 2012.{{cite web | url = http://www.destructoid.com/the-binding-of-isaac-gets-a-grotesque-retail-edition-220544.phtml | title = The Binding of Isaac gets a grotesque retail edition | first = Fraser | last = Brown | date = January 28, 2012 | accessdate = May 10, 2016 | work = [[Destructoid]] }} === Soundtrack === Danny Baranowsky, the game's composer and who previously worked with McMillen on ''Super Meat Boy'', was involved early on with the project shortly after the completion of the first prototype. McMillen and Baranowsky worked back and forth, with McMillen providing artwork from the game and allowing Baranowsky to develop the musical themes based on that; this would often lead to McMillen creating more art to support the music as it progressed. Baranowsky had been drawn to ''The Binding of Isaac'' as though the game puts forth a dark tone, he stated it had rather silly undertones underneath and such that one could not take it too seriously.{{cite web | url = http://www.gamesradar.com/binding-isaac-cave-story-3d-and-crying-poop-interview-composer-danny-b/ | title = The Binding of Isaac, Cave Story 3D, and crying at poop: an interview with composer Danny B | first = Hollander | last = Cooper | date = October 24, 2011 | accessdate = April 25, 2016 | work = [[Games Radar]] }} Some of the songs were inspired by classical choral music but modified to fit the theme of the game. Other works were inspired by boss fight songs composed by [[Nobuo Uematsu]] for the ''[[Final Fantasy]]'' series. Baranowsky also had additional time after finishing the main songs for the game to craft short additional tracks that were used for special rooms like shops and secret areas.{{cite web | url = http://kotaku.com/5870347/the-best-game-music-of-2011-the-binding-of-isaac | title = The Best Game Music of 2011: The Binding of Isaac | first = Kirk | last = Hamilton | date = December 22, 2011 | accessdate = May 10, 2016 | work = [[Kotaku]] }} === Cancelled Nintendo 3DS port === In January 2012, as the game has surpassed 450,000 units sold, McMillen stated that he was approached by a publisher that had interest in bringing the title to the [[Nintendo 3DS]] as a downloadable title through the [[Nintendo eShop]], though McMillen had reservations given Nintendo's reputation for less risque content.{{Cite web | url = http://www.shacknews.com/article/71868/the-binding-of-isaac-mega-expansion-incoming | title = The Binding of Isaac 'mega expansion' incoming | first = Alice | last = O'Conner | date = January 6, 2012 | accessdate = December 23, 2015 | work = [[Shacknews]] }} In late February, McMillen stated that Nintendo had rejected the game because of "questionable religious content". He believed this stemmed from Germany's classification board rating the existing Windows version of the game as "age 16+" due to potentially [[Blasphemy|blasphemous]] content, the first such time a game was rated in that manner in the country.{{cite web|title= 16er-Einstufung wegen... Blasphemie|url=http://www.4players.de/4players.php/spielinfonews/PC-CDROM/27752/2091117/The_Binding_of_Isaac16er-Einstufung_wegen_Blasphemie.html|date=January 4, 2012|accessdate=February 9, 2012|language=German|trans-title=16 rating because of... blasphemy}}{{cite web| url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2012/02/29/binding-of-isaac-blocked-from-3ds-due-to-quot-questionable-religious-content-quot.aspx|title=Binding Of Isaac Blocked From 3DS Due To "Questionable Religious Content"|publisher=[[Game Informer]] |first=Phil|last=Kollar|date=February 29, 2012|accessdate=March 1, 2012|quote=''In a follow-up tweet, McMillen confirmed that the decision was "due to the games [''sic''] 'questionable religious content.' He then took the opportunity to praise Steam for being such an open and supporting platform for independent and digitally distributed games.''}}{{cite web| url=http://www.destructoid.com/nintendo-wont-allow-the-binding-of-isaac-on-the-3ds-eshop-222917.phtml|title=Nintendo won't allow Binding of Isaac on the 3DS eShop|publisher=[[Destructoid]] |date=February 29, 2012 |accessdate=February 29, 2012|quote=It's a disgusting and sad situation, and I can only hope that something is done soon to change the way both Nintendo, and the industry in general, views the role between the hardware developers and software artists.(...)''"All this stuff has opened my eyes so much more to the freedom devs have with Steam. Censorship like this doesn't pop up that often in games, and there are only a handful of "banned video games" or highly censored ones. It's nice to have the freedom to publish something that speaks its mind about religion on a platform like Steam."''}}{{cite web | url = https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2012/02/nintendo-blocks-3ds-binding-of-isaac-for-questionable-religious-content/ | title = Nintendo blocks 3DS Binding of Isaac for "questionable religious content" | date = February 29, 2012 | accessdate = December 23, 2015 | first = Andrew | last = Groen | work = [[Ars Technica]] }} McMillen noted that Nintendo executives he spoke to before this decision had noted some blasphemous content would have been acceptable, and were more concerned with overtly religious content. He also noted that he was approached about his willingness to make some changes to the game to make it more suitable for the 3DS, but never was given a list of specific changes. McMillen speculated that Nintendo was worried about its reputation; because of the game's resemblance to ''The Legend of Zelda'', an unknowing child could potentially have downloaded the title and been shocked by the content, which would have reflected poorly on Nintendo.{{cite web | url = https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2012/03/binding-of-isaac-creator-nintendo-rejection-shows-internal-divisions-over-companys-image/ | title = Binding of Isaac creator: Nintendo rejection shows internal divisions over company’s image | first= Kyle | last= Orland | date = March 6, 2012 | accessdate = May 10, 2016 | work = [[Ars Technica]] }} Several game websites were outraged at Nintendo's decision. Though disappointed with Nintendo's decision, McMillen did not think the loss of the 3DS port was a major issue, and saw a brief sales burst on Steam as the news was covered in gaming website. McMillen further praised the flexibility of the Steam platform, which does not require games to obtain [[ESRB]] ratings to be published on the service, and the freedom it gave to the publishers regardless of the game content. Nintendo would later allow the ''Rebirth'' remake to be released on both the New Nintendo 3DS and the [[Wii U]] in 2015; this came in part for three executives within Nintendo—Steve Singer, the vice president of licensing; Mark Griffin, a senior manager in licensing, and Dan Adelman, the head of indie development—that championed support for ''The Binding of Isaac''.{{Cite web | url = http://www.polygon.com/2015/4/3/8341137/how-a-love-of-nintendo-finally-opened-the-door-for-the-binding-of | title= How a love of Nintendo opened the door for The Binding of Isaac and why it's only coming to New 3DS | first = Brian | last = Crecente | date = April 3, 2015 | accessdate = February 7, 2016 | work = [[Polygon (website)|Polygon]] }} === ''Wrath of the Lamb'' === {{Redirect|Wrath of the Lamb|the religious apocalypse|Book of Revelation}} An expansion to the game, entitled ''Wrath of the Lamb'', was released through Steam on May 28, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.joystiq.com/2012/05/07/the-binding-of-isaacs-wrath-of-the-lamb-begins-may-28/|title=The Binding of Isaac's Wrath of the Lamb begins May 28|publisher=[[Joystiq]]|first=JC|last=Fletcher|date=May 7, 2012|accessdate=May 7, 2012}} McMillen was inspired to create the expansion not only due to the success of the base game, but because his wife Danielle had fully completed the base game, the first game he had written in which she had shown significant interest. The expansion adds 70% more content to the original, and contains more than 10 bosses, over 100 items, over 40 unlocks, two additional endings, and two additional optional levels.{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2012/05/07/huge-binding-of-isaac-expansion-coming-in-may.aspx|title=The Binding of Isaac Expansion Dated|publisher=[[Game Informer]]|first=Jeff|last=Marchiafava|date=May 7, 2012|accessdate=May 7, 2012}} This expansion added new "alternate" floors, which can replace the normal floors, creating an alternate route through the game. These floors contain harder enemies, and a different set of bosses. Other features include a new item type, Trinkets, which have a variety of passive or triggered effects when carried, as well as new room types.{{cite web | url = http://gamasutra.com/view/news/129312/McMillen_details_The_Wrath_Of_The_Lamb_as_Binding_Of_Isaac_sells_450k.php | title = McMillen details The Wrath Of The Lamb, as Binding Of Isaac sells 450k | work = [[Gamasutra]] | date =January 30, 2012 | accessdate = April 14, 2016 | first = Lewie | last = Proctor }} McMillen had plans to release a second expansion beyond ''Wrath of the Lamb'', but was constrained by the limits of Flash at this point. === ''The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth'' === {{Main|The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth}} Sometime in 2012 after ''Isaac''{{'}} release, McMillen was approached by Tyrone Rodriguez of [[Nicalis]] who asked if McMillen was interested in bringing the game to consoles. McMillen was interested, but insisted that they would have to reprogram the game to get around the limitations of Flash as to include "Wrath of Lamb" and the second planned expansion, remaking the game's graphics in 16-bit instead of vector-based Flash graphics. Further, McMillen had wanted nothing to do with the business aspects of the game, having recounted the difficulties he had in handling this for ''Super Meat Boy''. Nicalis agreed to these, and began work in 2012 on what would become ''[[The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth]]'', an improved version of the title. It was released on November 4, 2014 for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[OS X]], [[Linux]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[PlayStation Vita]],{{cite web | url = https://www.vg247.com/2014/11/04/the-binding-of-isaac-rebirth-out-now-on-steam-psn/ | title = The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth out now on Steam, PSN | first = Brenna | last = Hillier | date = November 4, 2014 | accessdate = April 20, 2016 | work = [[VG247]] }} with versions for the [[Wii U]], [[New Nintendo 3DS]], and [[Xbox One]] released on July 23, 2015.{{Cite web | url = http://arstechnica.co.uk/gaming/2015/07/sacrilegious-binding-of-isaac-rebirth-finally-launches-on-nintendo-systems/ | title = Sacrilegious Binding of Isaac: Rebirth finally launches on Nintendo systems | first = Sam | last = Machkovech | work = [[Ars Technica]] | date = July 23, 2015 | accessdate = April 20, 2016 }} The game introduced numerous new playable characters, items, enemies, bosses, challenges, and room layout seeds for floors. A content pack, entitled "Afterbirth" was released for ''Rebirth'' starting October 2015, adding new alternate chapters, characters and items, as well as wave-based Greed mode.{{cite web | url= http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-09-08-the-binding-of-isaacs-meaty-afterbirth-expansion-pushes-out-a-release-date | title=The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth's meaty Afterbirth expansion pushes out a release date | work=[[Eurogamer]] | publisher=Gamer Network | first=Tom | last=Phillips | date=September 8, 2015 | accessdate=September 8, 2015}} A second update, "Afterbirth+", added further additional content and support for user-created [[mod (video gaming)|modifications]], and was released on January 3, 2017.{{Cite web | url = http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-12-08-the-binding-of-isaac-to-receive-mod-tools-dlc | title = The Binding of Isaac to receive mod tools DLC | first = Jeffrey | last = Matulef | date = December 8, 2015 | accessdate = December 8, 2015 | work =[[Eurogamer]] }} === Other games === McMillen is currently working with James Id to develop ''[[The Legend of Bum-bo]]'', which McMillen expects to release between December of 2018 or first half of 2019. ''Bum-bo'' is described as a prequel to ''Isaac'', and Isaac and [[Gish (video game)|Gish]] will appear as characters in the game.{{cite web | url = https://www.destructoid.com/binding-of-isaac-prequel-on-target-for-a-2017-release-459165.phtml | title = Binding of Isaac prequel on target for a 2017 release | first = Kevin | last = Mersereau | date = September 5, 2017 | accessdate = September 5, 2017 | work = [[Destructoid]] }} Isaac also appears as a playable character in the fighting game ''[[Blade Strangers]]'' and the puzzle game ''[[Crystal Crisis]]''. On June 27th, 2018, Edmund McMillen announced a card game adaptation in cooperation with [[ProSiebenSat.1 Media|Studio 71]] titled ''[[The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls]]''{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/edmundmcmillen/status/1011368569332887553|title=The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls Announcement|website=Twitter|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-27}}. == Reception == {{Video game reviews | title = The Binding of Isaac | MC = 84/100 | EuroG = 9/10 | Edge = 8/10 | GI = 8/10 | GSpot = 8/10 | GSpy = {{rating|4.5|5}} | IGN = 7.5/10 }} ''The Binding of Isaac'' received generally favorable reviews from game critics. On [[Metacritic]], the game has an average of 84 out of 100 based on 30 reviews.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/the-binding-of-isaac|title=The Binding of Isaac for PC Metacritic Score|accessdate=November 3, 2011|publisher=CBS Interactive|work=Metacritic}} ''The Binding of Isaac'' has been received by reviewers as a game with high replayability with the extensive range and combinations of power-ups that the player can encounter during a run-through, while providing an accessible ''Zelda''-inspired framework that most video game players would recognize and easily come to understand. John Teti for ''[[Eurogamer]]'' praised the game for its replayability through the randomization aspects, calling it "the most accessible exploration of the roguelike idea" that he had seen.{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-10-07-the-binding-of-isaac-review|title=The Binding of Isaac Review|first=John|last=Teti|accessdate=November 3, 2011|date=October 7, 2011|work=[[Eurogamer]]}} ''[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]]''{{'}}s similarly commented on the lure to replay the game due to its short playthrough time, calling it "an imaginative and quick-witted arcade experience that manages to be both depraved and strangely sweet by turn".{{cite web | url = http://www.next-gen.biz/reviews/binding-isaac-review | title = The Binding of Isaac Review | date = October 7, 2011 | work = [[Edge (magazine)|Edge]] | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20111008084139/http://www.next-gen.biz/reviews/binding-isaac-review | archivedate = October 8, 2011 | accessdate = April 14, 2016 }} [[GameSpot]]'s Maxwell McGee stated that the game smartly has removed extraneous features such that "what remains is a tightly focused game that continues to feel fresh even after multiple completions".{{cite web | url = http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/the-binding-of-isaac-review/1900-6346463/ | title = The Binding of Isaac Review | first = Maxwell | last = McGee | date = November 21, 2011 | accessdate = April 14, 2016 | work = [[GameSpot]] }} Though the game is considered to be accessible to new players, reviewers found the game to be a difficult challenge, often set by the randomness of what power-ups the player happened to acquire during a single run. Writers for ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' rated the game an A on a grading scale, and favorably compared the title to McMillen's ''Super Meat Boy'', requiring the player to have "masochistic patience in the face of terrible odds".{{cite web | url = http://www.avclub.com/article/october-10-2011-63022 | title = Sawbuck Gamer, October 10, 2011 | work = [[The A.V. Club]] | authors = Anthony John Agnello, Noah Cruickshank, Russ Fischer, Steve Heisler, Rowan Kaiser, Gus Mastrapa, Samantha Nelson, Tasha Robinson, and John Teti | date = October 10, 2011 | accessdate = April 14, 2016 }} This difficulty was considered mitigated by the large number of possible power-ups that the game offers, most would not be seen by players until they have replayed the game many times. McGee noted that while players can review what items they have discovered prior to a run-through, this feature does not explain what each item does, leaving the effect to be determined by the player while in game. ''[[Game Informer]]''{{'}}s Adam Biessener noted that while ''The Binding of Isaac'' had a number of software bugs on release that may briefly detract from the experience, "McMillen’s vision shines through" in the game's playability, art style, and story.{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/the_binding_of_isaac/b/pc/archive/2011/10/03/equal-parts-gross-disturbing-and-fun.aspx|title=Equal Parts Gross, Disturbing, And Fun – The Binding of Isaac – PC| work = [[Game Informer]] |date=October 3, 2011|accessdate= November 3, 2011|first=Adam|last=Biessener}} Neilie Johnson for ''[[IGN]]'' found that some players may be put off by the game's crudeness but otherwise "it's totally random, highly creative and brutally unforgiving".{{cite web|first=Neilie|last=Johnson|url=http://pc.ign.com/articles/119/1199423p1.html|title=The Binding of Isaac Review – PC Review at IGN|publisher=IGN Entertainment|work=[[IGN]]|date=October 11, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011}} Similarly, Nathan Muenier for ''[[GameSpy]]'' noted the game had some shock value that one must work past, but otherwise was " imaginative" and "utterly absorbing".{{cite web|url=http://pc.gamespy.com/pc/the-binding-of-isaac/1197645p1.html|title=GameSpy: The Binding of Isaac Review – Page 1|publisher=IGN Entertainment|work=[[GameSpy]]|date=September 30, 2011|accessdate=November 3, 2011|first=Nathan|last=Meunier}} Alternatively, Jordan Devore for ''[[Destructoid]]'' considered the visual style of the game one of its "biggest selling points", following from McMillen's past style of [[dark comedy]] from ''Super Meat Boy''.{{Cite web | url = http://www.destructoid.com/review-the-binding-of-isaac-212806.phtml | title = Review: The Binding of Isaac | work = [[Destructoid]] | first = Jordan | last = Devore | date = October 2, 2011 | accessdate = May 9, 2016 }} Baranowsky's soundtrack was found by reviewers to well-suit the themes of the game, and used appropriately to avoid extensive repetition during a playthrough. Kirk Hamilton of ''[[Kotaku]]'' called the soundtrack as the combination of several genres and the musical styles of [[Danny Elfman]], [[Muse (band)|Muse]], and ''[[Music of Final Fantasy|Final Fantasy]]'' that created something "dark and unique". ''The Binding of Isaac'' was nominated in the Best Independent Game category at the 2011 [[Spike Video Game Awards]], but lost to ''[[Minecraft]]''.{{cite web | url = http://www.gamesradar.com/2011-spike-vga-nominees-announced-zelda-become-first-hall-famer/ | title = 2011 Spike VGA nominees announced, Zelda to become first Hall of Famer | first = Matt | last = Bradford | date = November 17, 2011 | accessdate = May 10, 2016 | work = [[GamesRadar]] }} McMillen had only expected the game to sell a few hundred copies when he released it on Steam. For the first few months of its release, sales were roughly a few hundred per day, but shortly thereafter, McMillen found sales suddenly were boosted, a fact he attributed to numerous [[Let's Play (video gaming)|Let's Play]] videos that had been published by players to showcase the game and drove sales.{{cite web | url = https://www.pcgamer.com/how-mods-made-the-binding-of-isaac-a-phenomenon-and-why-edmund-mcmillens-laying-it-to-rest/ | title = How mods made The Binding of Isaac a phenomenon, and why Edmund McMillen's laying it to rest | first = Anthony | last= McGlynn | date = June 5, 2018 | accessdate = June 5, 2018 | work = [[PC Gamer]] }} This popularity also drew interest by players that wanted to create [[Mod (video gaming)|custom mods]] for the game, which would become a factor in the design of the sequel to better support modding. By November 2012, the game sold over one million copies, with at least one-quarter of those having purchased the "Wrath of the Lamb" extension. As of July 2014, the game has sold over 3 million copies.{{cite web | url = http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/07/04/roguelikes-the-rebirth-of-the-counterculture | title = Roguelikes: The Rebirth of the Counterculter | first = Mike | last = Mahardy | date = July 4, 2014 | accessdate = December 23, 2015 | work = [[IGN]] }} By July 2015, following the release of ''Rebirth'', the combined games had over 5 million units sold.{{cite web | url = http://www.gtweekly.com/index.php/santa-cruz-news/good-times-cover-stories/6746-the-binding-of-edmund-mcmillen.html | title = The Binding of Edmund McMillen | first = Sam | last = Working | publisher = [[Good Times (newspaper)|Good Times]] | date = July 22, 2015 | accessdate = February 11, 2016 }} ''The Binding of Isaac'' is said to be a contributing factor towards the growth of the [[roguelike]] genre since around 2010, with its success paving the way for later games that used the roguelike formula, such as ''[[FTL: Faster Than Light]]'' and ''[[Don't Starve]]''.{{cite web | url = http://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2015/07/before-spelunky-and-ftl-there-was-only-ascii.html | title = Before Spelunky and FTL, There Was Only ASCII | first = Mark | last = Johnson | work = [[Paste (magazine)|Paste]] | date = July 22, 2015 | accessdate = April 14, 2016 }} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{Official {{redirect|The Valley of Peace|the Slovene film|Valley of Peace (film)}} [[File:Wadi Al-Salaam.jpg|thumb|right|250px|An aerial view of Wadi-us-Salam cemetery]] '''Wadi-us-Salaam''' ({{lang-ar|وادي السلام|Wādī as-Salām|lit=Valley of Peace}}) is an [[Islam]]ic [[cemetery]], located in the [[Holiest sites in Shia Islam|Shia holy city]] of [[Najaf]], [[Iraq]]. It is the largest cemetery in the world.<ref name="FattahCaso2009">{{cite book|author1=Hala Mundhir Fattah|author2=Frank Caso|title=A brief history of Iraq|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Q_-hrXU-mWYC&pg=PA140|accessdate=18 October 2010|year=2009|publisher=Infobase Publishing|isbn=978-0-8160-5767-2|page=140}}</ref> The cemetery covers {{convert|1485.5|acre|ha sqkm sqmi|2|lk=on}} and contains tens of millions of bodies.<ref>[http://www.washingtonmonthly.com/archives/individual/2004_08/004514.php HOW BIG IS WADI-US-SALAAM CEMETERY?], washingtonmonthly.com.</ref> It also attracts millions of pilgrims annually.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Anthony Ham|title=Middle East|date=15 Sep 2010|publisher=Lonely Planet|isbn=9781742203591|page=224}}</ref>
The cemetery is located near the [[Imam Ali Mosque|shrine]] of [[Imam]] [[Ali ibn Abi Talib]], the fourth [[Sunni]] Caliph and the first [[Shia]] Imam.<ref name="USATODAY"/> Thus, many Shi'ites in Iraq request that they be buried in this cemetery.<ref name="USATODAY"/> As a result of improved transportation methods, Shi'ites from across the globe are (or seek to be) buried in the cemetery. However, burial at the cemetery "means being placed in one of the cemetery’s many [[catacombs]]."<ref name="Al-Akhbar English">{{cite news|author1=Qassem Fayyad|title=Wadi al-Salam: A Cemetery to Cleanse Sins|url=http://english.al-akhbar.com/content/wadi-al-salam-cemetery-cleanse-sins#comment-41087|accessdate=29 March 2015|work=Al-Akhbar English|date=19 September 2012}}</ref> According to an [[undertaker]] at the cemetery, each [[crypt]] can hold up to 50 bodies.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Yasser Tabbaa|author2=Sabrina Mervin|title=Najaf, the Gate of wisdom|date=28 July 2014|publisher=UNESCO|isbn=9789231000287|page=181}}</ref> The burial plots are controlled by [[Marja']].<ref>{{cite book|author1=George Farag|title=Diaspora and Transitional Administration: Shiite Iraqi Diaspora and the Administration of Post-Saddam Hussein Iraq|date=2007|publisher=ProQuest|isbn=9780549410034|page=131}}</ref>
==The Shia traditions== [[File:Masjid Iraq.jpg|right|thumb|200px|Maqam al-Mahdi in Wadi-us-salam]] Shia tradition holds that [[Abraham]] bought land in Wadi-us-Salaam and that Ali said the Wadi Al-Salaam was a part of heaven.<ref>{{cite book|editor1-last=Dumper|editor1-first=Michael|editor2-last=Stanley|editor2-first=Bruce E.|title=Cities of the Middle East and North Africa: A Historical Encyclopedia|date=2007|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=9781576079195|page=269|edition=illustrated|quote=There is also the tradition that Abraham bought land in the Wadi as-Salaam (Valley of Peace) that runs through the present city, predicting that it would be from here that 70,000 of those buried in the valley would be guaranteed entrance into paradise and would then be able to intercede with Allah for others. Imam Ali is reported to have said that Wadi as-Salaam was a part of heaven.}}</ref> Shia also widely believe that Ali has the power to intercede for the deceased—lessening their suffering—during the passage of their soul from the worldly life<ref>{{cite book|author1=Yasser Tabbaa|author2=Sabrina Mervin|title=Najaf, the Gate of wisdom|date=28 July 2014|publisher=UNESCO|isbn=9789231000287|pages=162–3}}</ref> and if they are buried there "they will be raised from the dead on judgment day with their spiritual leader."<ref>{{cite news|author1=MARIA ABI-HABIB|title=In Iraq, War Strains World's Largest Cemetery|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/iraq-insurgency-puts-strains-on-massive-cemetery-1404868672|accessdate=30 March 2015|work=The Wall Street Journal|date=8 July 2014}}</ref>
The Shia are encouraged to bury their dead at the location through religious edicts<ref name="Al-Akhbar English"/> and the cemetery's expansion is also seen as being a result of Shi'isms "more permissive attitude than Sunnism with regard to the commemoration of the dead and the erection of mausoleums."<ref>{{cite book|author1=Yasser Tabbaa|author2=Sabrina Mervin|title=Najaf, the Gate of wisdom|date=28 July 2014|publisher=UNESCO|isbn=9789231000287|page=162|quote=In addition to historical precedence, there are at least two main factors that have contributed to the expansion of cemeteries around Najaf, and specifically in Wadi al-Salam. First, Shi'ism has developed a somewhat more permissive attitude than Sunnism with regard to the commemoration of the dead and the erection of mausoleums...}}</ref>
Some rituals carried out before burial in the cemetery include: the body is washed and wrapped at the cemetery, the funeral prayers are conducted in the Imam Ali shrine, the deceased is carried around the shrine three times, and some Quranic verses are recited at the cemetery.<ref>{{cite book|author1=George Farag|title=Diaspora and Transitional Administration: Shiite Iraqi Diaspora and the Administration of Post-Saddam Hussein Iraq|date=2007|publisher=ProQuest|isbn=9780549410034|pages=131–2}}</ref>
==History== Daily burials have been on going for over 1,400 years and the site is on the [[List of World Heritage Sites in Iraq#Tentative list|Tentative List of UNESCO's World Heritage sites]].<ref>[http://whc.unesco.org/en/tentativelists/5578/ Wadi Al-Salam Cemetery in Najaf], unesco.org.</ref> Burials in Najaf have been documented as early as the [[Parthian Empire|Parthian]] and [[Sassanid]] eras and ancient [[Mesopotamian]] cities often had similar cemeteries, where there was an accumulation of tombs.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Yasser Tabbaa|author2=Sabrina Mervin|title=Najaf, the Gate of wisdom|date=28 July 2014|publisher=UNESCO|isbn=9789231000287|page=162|quote=Such burial sites are quite common in ancient Mesopotamian cities, where the accumulation of tombs has created mounds on the outskirts of these early settlements}}</ref>
It is estimated that during the [[Iraq War]] about 200 to 250 corpses were buried there daily; however, in 2010 this number had decreased to less than 100.<ref name="USATODAY">[http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/world/2010-05-25-cemetery-iraq_N.htm Najaf cemetery witness to Iraq's tragic history], usatoday.com.</ref> Approximately 500,000 new bodies are interred in the cemetery annually from across the globe.<ref>{{cite news|title=World's biggest cemetery: 1,400-year-old Iraqi burial site contains over FIVE MILLION bodies and - as the country descends into new chaos - counting . . .|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2697547/Worlds-biggest-cemetery-1-400-year-old-Iraqi-burial-site-contains-five-million-bodies-counting.html|accessdate=29 March 2015|work=DAILY MAIL|date=19 July 2014}}</ref> This figure is an increase on the approximately 20,000 bodies, primarily from Iran, that used to be interred annually in the early 20th century.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Yasser Tabbaa|author2=Sabrina Mervin|title=Najaf, the Gate of wisdom|date=28 July 2014|publisher=UNESCO|isbn=9789231000287|page=163}}</ref> Most Iraqi and many Iranian Shi'ites have a relative buried in the cemetery.<ref>{{cite book|editor1-last=Fair|editor1-first=C. Christine|editor2-last=Ganguly|editor2-first=Sumit|title=Treading on Hallowed Ground:Counterinsurgency Operations in Sacred Spaces|date=27 Aug 2008|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=9780199711895|page=145}}</ref>
As of 2014—coinciding with conflict against [[ISIL]]—it has been reported that burial plots are running out, resulting in many being stolen, illegally resold or improvised.<ref>{{cite web|author1=UNESCOPRESS|title=A new UNESCO publication pays tribute to Iraqi cultural heritage|url=http://www.unesco.org/new/en/media-services/single-view/news/a_new_unesco_publication_pays_tribute_to_iraqi_cultural_heritage/#.VRiesvyUeSo|accessdate=30 March 2015|date=19 November 2014}}</ref> According to one gravedigger: “I’ve never had it so busy. Not even [[Iraq War|after 2003]] or 2006 [the height of [[Civil war in Iraq (2006–07)|Iraq’s civil war]]].”<ref>{{cite news|title=Islamic State: The pushback|url=https://www.economist.com/news/briefing/21646752-sustaining-caliphate-turns-out-be-much-harder-declaring-one-islamic-state-not|accessdate=22 April 2015|work=[[The Economist]]|date=21 Mar 2015}}</ref>
==Prominent burials== *[[Grand Ayatollah]] [[Mohammad Mohammad Sadeq al-Sadr]] – his mausoleum is possibly the most visited in the cemetery.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Yasser Tabbaa|author2=Sabrina Mervin|title=Najaf, the Gate of wisdom|date=28 July 2014|publisher=UNESCO|isbn=9789231000287|page=180}}</ref> *Grand Ayatollah [[Muhammad Baqir al-Sadr]]{{Cn|date=January 2017}} * Prophet [[Hud (prophet)|Hood]] * Prophet [[Saleh]]

'''Yazidis in Germany''' may refer to people born in or residing in [[Germany]] of full or partial [[Yazidis|Yazidi]] origin.
There is a large Yazidi community in Germany, estimated to be numbering around 60,000 people.<ref name="deutschewelle"/> This makes the German Yazidi community one of the largest Yazidi communities in the Yazidi diaspora.
==Immigration history== Many Yazidis fled to Germany during the 1990s fearing religious persecution in [[Turkey]]. The Yazidi population of Germany was around 20,000 in 1998.<ref name="adherents"/> Many Yazidi intellectuals also fled during this time and now play a prominent role in Yazidi diaspora affairs and maintain connections with Yazidis in [[Iraq]].<ref name="iranica"/>
==Political activism== In August, 2014, German Yazidis held protests against the [[persecution of Yazidis by ISIL]]. Between 5,000 and 10,000 people attended the demonstrations.<ref name="deutschewelle"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/germany-1000s-protest-yazidi-persecution-iraq-160416354.html |title=Germany: 1000s protest Yazidi persecution in Iraq |publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] |accessdate=2014-10-16}}</ref>

3 daughters | occupation = | profession = | alma_mater = | semicha = | signature = }} '''Yechiel Fishel Eisenbach''' (1925 – 4 September 2008) was a [[Haredi Judaism|Haredi]] rabbi and long-time [[rosh yeshiva]] of [[Shaar Hashamayim Yeshiva]] in [[Jerusalem]]. He was widely regarded as one of the greatest [[Kabbalah|kabbalists]] in [[Israel]],{{cite web |url=http://thefrumnews.blogspot.com/2008/09/petirah-of-rav-yechiel-fishel-eisenbach.html |title=Petira of Rav Yechiel Fishel Eisenbach, zt"l |date=5 September 2008 |accessdate=25 September 2011 |publisher=Frum News Report}} and was an expert in the writings of the [[Isaac Luria|Arizal]] and the ''[[siddur]]'' of the [[Shalom Sharabi|Rashash]]."HaRav Yechiel Fishel Eisenbach". ''[[Hamodia]]'', Israel News, September 11, 2008, p. A23.{{cite web |url=http://zchusavos.blogspot.com/2010/08/elul-yartzeits.html |title=Elul Yahrtzeits |publisher=Zchus Avos Yogen Aleinu |date=1 September 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011}} ==Early life== He was born in Jerusalem to Rabbi Yosef Eisenbach, a ''[[sofer]]'' (scribe), and studied in the [[Talmud Torah]] and [[yeshiva]] of Shomrei HaChomot. He was also one of the first students of Yeshivat Beit Avraham-Slonim, which was then led by Rabbi [[Sholom Noach Berezovsky]], the Rebbe of [[Slonim (Hasidic dynasty)|Slonim]]. After his marriage in 1944 to the daughter of Rabbi [[Asher Zelig Margolios]], a noted kabbalist, Rabbi Eisenbach studied at the [[Pressburg Yeshiva (Jerusalem)|Pressburg Yeshiva]] under Rabbi [[Akiva Sofer]] (the Daas Sofer); the [[Toras Emes]] ([[Chabad]]) yeshiva; and Kollel Shomrei HaChomot. He was well known for his 18-hour day of learning, as well as his humility. Occasionally he gave [[Shiur (Torah)|shiurim]] (lectures) on Torah and fear of God to unmarried students. At different times, he served as [[mashgiach ruchani]] for the Slonim Yeshiva, and as ''[[maggid shiur]]'' (lecturer) for an elite group of students at Toras Emes. ==Rosh yeshiva== In 1973, Rabbi [[Refoel Dovid Auerbach]] of Shaar Hashamayim Yeshiva asked Rabbi Eisenbach to assume the mantle of rosh yeshiva after the passing of Rabbi [[Aharon Slotkin]]. Rabbi Eisenbach's proficiency in kabbalah was well known. He knew all the writings of the Arizal and the siddur of the Rashash by heart, and was an expert in [[Jewish services|davening]] with the ''kavannot'' (mystical intentions) of these kabbalistic masters. Over the next 35 years, he taught thousands of students of kabbalah at the yeshiva, as well as began a new study of the ''kavannot'' of the Rashash. ==Illness and death== His health progressively worsened in the two years before his death at the age of 83. ''Hespedim'' (eulogies) were delivered at his yeshiva by Rabbi [[Gamliel Rabinowitz]], a fellow rosh yeshiva of Shaar Hashamayim Yeshiva; Rabbi [[Shmuel Auerbach]], yeshiva president; Rabbi Reuven Gross; Rabbi [[Yaakov Hillel]]; and Rabbi Eisenbach's son-in-law, Rabbi [[Moshe Uri Eisenstein]], a rabbi from the [[Givat Shaul]] neighborhood of Jerusalem. He was buried on the [[Mount of Olives]]. Rabbi Eisenbach is survived by two sons, Rabbi Yaakov Tzvi Eisenbach and Rabbi Yechezkel Eisenbach, and three sons-in-law: Rabbi Moshe Uri Eisenstein (Rav of the [[Givat Shaul]] neighborhood of Jerusalem, Rabbi Tovia Miller, and Rabbi Chanina Karpman, along with grandchildren and great-grandchildren. ==References== {{reflist}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Eisenbach, Yechiel Fishel}} [[Category:Israeli Rosh yeshivas]] [[Category:Kabbalists]] [[Category:20th-century rabbis]] [[Category:21st-century rabbis]] [[Category:Haredi rabbis in Israel]] [[Category:Rabbis in Jerusalem]] [[Category:People from Jerusalem]] [[Category:1925 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]]
